item.description: Lesson 2 있다: To have This usage of 있다 in Korean is an adjective. Sentences with adjectives cannot act on objects, thus you cannot have a word with the particle ~을/를 attached to it if the predicating word in a sentence is an adjective. To get around this, we can attach ~이/가 to the object instead in sentences with 있다. To indicate the thing that a person “has” in sentences with 있다.
